 Removes a pixmap from a widget that was set through the use of XuSetButtonArrow and restores it to its original form.

Detailed Description

Pixmap creation functions.

Note:
The pixmaps created by these functions are cached so that any pixmap is not created more than once per display. The cache is only added to and entries are not destroyed but made available for reuse.
Author:
R.D.Paterson
Date:
2005/03/15 Creation

Function Documentation

void XuClearButtonArrow (  Widget  w  ) 
 

Removes a pixmap from a widget that was set through the use of XuSetButtonArrow and restores it to its original form.

param[in] w The widget to restore

Note:
The widget userData resource is set back to NULL.

Pixmap XuCreateArrowPixmap (  Widget  w,
XuArrowAttributes *  attrib
) 
 

Create a pixmap containing an arrow.

Parameters:
[in] w A reference widget
[in] attrib The arrow attributes
Returns:
The created pixmap
Arrow Attributes:

The arrow attributes are set through the use the following XuArrowAttributes structure.

 long                flags
 long                appearance
 XuARROW_ORIENTATION direction
 int                 height
 int                 width
 int                 margin_height
 int                 margin_width
 int                 outline_width
 Pixel               foreground
 Pixel               background

Which elements in the structure are used depends on the values set in the flags variable. This consists of a set of enumerated values which can be or'ed together to allow more then one element to be set. The values are:

  • XuARROW_APPEARANCE
  • XuARROW_DIRECTION
  • XuARROW_HEIGHT
  • XuARROW_WIDTH
  • XuARROW_MARGIN_HEIGHT
  • XuARROW_MARGIN_WIDTH
  • XuARROW_OUTLINE_WIDTH
  • XuARROW_FOREGROUND
  • XuARROW_BACKGROUND
  • XuARROW_TEXT_UNDER
  • XuARROW_ALL
The XuARROW_ALL is a convienience entry that indicates that all elements in the structure contain data.

The appearance must be some combination of the following values which can be or'ed together to produce a variety of arrow styles.

  • XuARROW_PLAIN The arrow head is a plain unadorned style
  • XuARROW_BARBED The arrow head has barbs.
  • XuARROW_BAR The arrow head has a bar across the tip
  • XuARROW_STEM The arrow head has a stem
  • XuARROW_OUTLINED The arrow is outlined
The direction must be one of the following:

  • XuARROW_UP
  • XuARROW_DOWN
  • XuARROW_RIGHT
  • XuARROW_LEFT

Pixmap XuCreateColoredPixmap (  Widget  w,
Pixel  fg,
int  width,
int  height
) 
 

Create a pixmap with the same depth as the given widget.

Parameters:
[in] w Reference widget
[in] fg Colour to fill in the pixmap with.
[in] width Pixmap width
[in] height Pixmap height

Pixmap XuCreateInsensitivePixmap (  Widget  w,
Pixmap  pixmap
) 
 

Create an insensitive pixmap from the given pixmap.

Parameters:
[in] w A reference widget.
[in] pixmap The pixmap to make the insensitive pixmap from.
Returns:
The insensitive version of the input pixmap.
Note:
This we do by stippling the pixmap with 50% background colour.

void XuFreePixmap (  Widget  wid,
Pixmap  pix
) 
 

Free the specified pixmap.

param[in] wid A reference widget param[in] pix The pixmap to free

Note:
The pixmap and its cache structure are not actually freed until the reference count decreases to zero.

void XuSetButtonArrow (  Widget  w,
XuArrowAttributes *  attrib
) 
 

Replaces the text in the given widget with a pixmap containing an arrow.

Parameters:
[in] w The widget, which must be a subclass of label
[in] attrib The arrow attribute structure
Attention:
The XmNuserData resouce is used to hold the initial state of the widget and thus must not be used by any widget called with these functions.
Arrow Attributes: The arrow attributes are set through the use the following XuArrowAttributes structure.

 long                flags
 long                appearance
 XuARROW_ORIENTATION direction
 int                 height
 int                 width
 int                 margin_height
 int                 margin_width
 int                 outline_width
 Pixel               foreground
 Pixel               background
 Boolean             text_under

Which elements in the structure are used depends on the values set in the flags variable and not all of the elements in the structure are allowed to be set in this function. This consists of a set of enumerated values which can be or'ed together to allow more then one element to be set. The allowed values are:

  • XuARROW_APPEARANCE
  • XuARROW_DIRECTION
  • XuARROW_OUTLINE_WIDTH
  • XuARROW_FOREGROUND
  • XuARROW_BACKGROUND
  • XuARROW_TEXT_UNDER
The appearance must be some combination of the following values which can be or'ed together to produce a variety of arrow styles.

  • XuARROW_PLAIN The arrow head is a plain unadorned style
  • XuARROW_BARBED The arrow head has barbs.
  • XuARROW_BAR The arrow head has a bar across the tip
  • XuARROW_STEM The arrow head has a stem
  • XuARROW_OUTLINED The arrow is outlined
The direction must be one of the following:

  • XuARROW_UP
  • XuARROW_DOWN
  • XuARROW_RIGHT
  • XuARROW_LEFT
Note that there is not a flags entry for text_under as this is automatically looked for by this function. This determines if any text in the button is inserted "under" the arrow and would thus appear in the button along with the arrow. The default value is true.

Pixmap XuXpmFileToPixmap (  Widget  w,
String  fname,
XpmAttributes *  xpmatts
) 
 

Create a pixmap from the given xpm format file.

Parameters:
[in] w A reference widget
[in] fname The xpm file
[in] xpmatts The xpm attributes. See the xpm documentation for this.
Returns:
The resulting pixmap
